</EFX_BUSINESS>
<EFX_MANAGEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Enhanced Medication Therapy Management Program Development Opportunity
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have been selected to participate with a large, regional Medicare Part&nbsp;D Prescription Drug Plan, or Regional PDP, to develop
	and deliver an Enhanced Medication Therapy Management, or EMTM, program. We believe this EMTM program will address the requirements of the Part&nbsp;D Enhanced Medication Therapy Management Model
	test, which the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation, or CMMI, proposed in September 2015 and recently approved. Final approval will be authorized upon full execution of the calendar year 2017
	Medicare Part&nbsp;D contract.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Part&nbsp;D EMTM model created by the Centers for Medicare&nbsp;&amp; Medicaid Services, or CMS, is designed to test strategies to improve medication use among Medicare
	beneficiaries enrolled in Part&nbsp;D and to assess whether providing selected PDPs with additional incentives and increased flexibility to design and implement innovative programs will better
	achieve the overall goals for EMTM programs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
	develop this EMTM program, we will use our MRM Matrix and certain other services to perform medication risk stratification and reviews and safety assessments of complex medication
	regimens, providing an innovative, alternative approach to pharmacotherapy to the 240,000 members of this Regional PDP, representing less than one percent of the entire eligible Part&nbsp;D market.
	In 2015, the number of individuals covered through Medicare Part&nbsp;D programs was more than 39&nbsp;million. We believe if we are successful in developing and delivering an EMTM program to the
	Regional PDP, we will be able to expand into a greater portion of the Part&nbsp;D market. There can be no assurances that our EMTM program will be successful or we will actually be able to expand
	this program as currently contemplated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Equity Grants Under Special Equity Award Pool, Non-Employee Director Compensation Policy and
	Leadership Exit Bonus Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In September 2016, our board of directors approved grants of 700,386 shares of restricted common stock to our employees, including to
	our executive officers, under the 2014 Equity Compensation Plan pursuant to a special equity award pool previously approved by our board of directors, which will be made immediately prior to the
	effective date of the registration statement of which this prospectus forms a part. All shares of restricted common stock will vest in full on May&nbsp;31, 2017. The value of the grants, assuming an
	initial public offering price of $14.00 per share, which is the midpoint of the price range set forth on the cover page of this prospectus, is $9.8&nbsp;million. A non-cash
	compensation charge equal to the value of such grants will be recognized ratably over the vesting period from the date of grant through May&nbsp;31, 2017, when the shares underlying the grant fully
	vest. See "Executive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Narrative to Summary Compensation Table&nbsp;&#151; Long-Term Incentive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Special Equity Award Pool" for
	more information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also in September 2016, our board of directors approved grants of 22,260 shares of restricted common stock under the 2016 Equity Compensation Plan to each of our non-employee directors
	pursuant to our compensation policy for non-employee directors, which represents both the initial and annual grants to such directors, which will be made immediately prior to the effective date of the
	registration statement of which this prospectus forms&nbsp;a part. The value of the grants, assuming an initial public offering price of $14.00 per share, which is the midpoint of the price range
	set forth on the cover page of this prospectus, is $312&nbsp;thousand. A non-cash compensation charge equal to the value of such grants will be recognized ratably over the applicable vesting period,
	which, for the initial grants will be a three year period following the grant date, and for the annual grants the earlier of the next annual
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	66
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

</A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	shareholder meeting or the one year anniversary of the grant date. See "Executive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Non-Employee Director Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Leadership Exit Bonus Plan"
	for more information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the closing of this offering, 46,820 shares of common stock will be issued to certain of our executive officers pursuant to our Leadership Exit Bonus Plan and under our 2016 Equity
	Compensation Plan, which represents an amount equal to the Radius Shares surrendered at the completion of this offering less 24,570 shares of our common stock withheld for tax withholding purposes,
	based upon an assumed initial public offering price of $14.00 per share, which is the midpoint of the price range set forth on the cover page of this prospectus. The value of the issuance is
	$1.0&nbsp;million. A non-cash compensation charge equal to the value of such issuance will be recognized in the fourth quarter of 2016 as all shares issued will be fully vested upon issuance. See
	"Executive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Narrative to Summary Compensation Table&nbsp;&#151; Long-Term Incentive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Leadership Exit Bonus Plan" for more
	information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_DA49301_COMPONENTS_OF_OUR_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_TOC_DA49301_6">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Components of Our Results of Operations
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenue
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our revenue is derived from our product sales and service activities. For the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016, product
	sales represented 84% and 89% respectively, of our total revenue, and service revenue represented 16% and 11%, respectively, of our total revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, product sales represented 97% and 86%, respectively, of our total revenue, and service revenue represented 3% and 14%,
	respectively, of our total revenue. We did not generate service revenue until our acquisition of Capstone in April 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Product Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our product revenue is primarily generated through our medication risk management contracts with healthcare organizations. Our MRM
	Matrix technology enables our pharmacists to prospectively optimize personalized medication regimens for each patient. In 2015, we began offering software solutions on a standalone
	software-as-a-service basis, although to date, all of our medication risk management clients have contracted for a bundled offering of our software-enabled solutions, prescription fulfillment and
	reminder packaging services. We do not offer, and have not generated any revenue from, standalone prescription fulfillment and reminder packaging services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	our medication risk management contracts, revenue is generated through the following components:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prescription medication revenue.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We sell prescription medications directly to healthcare organizations through our
	prescription fulfillment
	pharmacies. Prescription medication fees are based upon the prices stated in client contracts for the prescription and include a dispensing fee. For the periods presented, substantially all of our
	product revenue has consisted of prescription medication revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Per member per month, or PMPM, fees.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We also receive a fixed monthly administrative fee for each member in the program
	contracted for medication
	risk management services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	revenue from prescription medication sales varies based on the number and mix of medications dispensed; however, based on our historical experience, patient populations at our
	clients do not generally decline over time, the number of medications per patient have been consistent following an initial onboarding period and the overall mix of medications dispensed is generally
	predictable. In addition, our dispensing fees vary directly with the volume of prescription medication sales each period. Our PMPM fees vary directly with the number of members serviced by our clients
	each month. Although revenue is generated from various sources, pricing and other key contractual terms are negotiated on a bundled basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=70,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=720777,FOLIO='67',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DA49301A.;58',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49301_1_68">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Service Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our service revenue is generated by the risk adjustment and pharmacy cost management services that we provide to healthcare
	organizations. Our client contracts for these services include a PMPM fee for selected services, monthly subscription fees, initial set up fees and hourly consulting charges. PMPM fees vary directly
	with the number of members serviced by our clients each month under our risk adjustment contracts. Additionally, service revenue includes data and statistics fees we receive from medication
	manufacturers for the sale of medication utilization data we collect through our pharmacy cost management engagements, which is recognized when we receive such amounts due to the variable nature of
	payment amounts. As noted above, PMPM fees associated with our medication risk management services are currently included in product revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Revenue
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Product Cost
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of product revenue includes all costs directly related to the medication risk management offering, including costs relating to
	our pharmacists' collaboration on a patient's medication management, medication risk analysis and offering guidance to the prescriber based upon the assessment of the MRM Matrix and the individual
	patient's medical history, as well as the fulfillment and distribution of prescription medications. Costs consist primarily of the purchase price of the prescription medications we dispense. For the
	six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016, prescription medication costs represented 77% and 76% of our total product costs, respectively. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015,
	prescription medication costs represented 75% and 76%, respectively, of our total product costs. In addition to costs incurred for the prescription medications we dispense, other costs include
	expenses to package, dispense and distribute prescription medications, expenses associated with our clinical pharmacist support centers and prescription fulfillment centers, including employment costs
	and stock-based compensation, and expenses related to the hosting of our technology platform. Such costs also include direct overhead expenses, as well as allocated miscellaneous overhead costs. We
	allocate miscellaneous overhead costs among functions based on employee headcount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Service Cost
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of service revenue includes all labor costs, including stock-based compensation expense, directly related to the risk adjustment
	and pharmacy cost management services and expenses for claims processing, technology services and overhead costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our research and development expenses consist primarily of salaries and related costs, including stock-based compensation expense, for
	personnel in our research and development functions, which include software developers, project managers and other employees engaged in the development and enhancement of our service offerings.
	Research and development expenses also include costs for design and development of new software and technology and new service offerings, as well as enhancement of existing software and technology and
	service offerings, including fees paid to third-party consultants, costs related to quality assurance and testing, and other allocated facility-related overhead and expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	continue to focus our research and development efforts on adding new features and applications, increasing the functionality and enhancing the ease of use of our existing suite of
	software solutions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	capitalize certain costs incurred in connection with obtaining or developing internal-use software, including external direct costs of material and services and payroll costs for
	employees directly involved with the software development. Capitalized software costs are amortized beginning when the software project is substantially complete and the asset is ready for its
	intended use. Costs incurred
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=71,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=123124,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DA49301A.;58',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49301_1_69">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	during
	the preliminary project stage and post-implementation stage, as well as maintenance and training costs, are expensed as incurred as part of research and development expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	expect our research and development expenses will increase in absolute dollars as we increase our research and development headcount to further strengthen and enhance our software
	solutions and service offerings, but will decrease as a percentage of revenue in the long term as we expect our revenue to increase at a greater rate than such expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sales and Marketing Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales and marketing expenses consist principally of salaries, commissions, bonuses, stock-based compensation and employee benefits for
	sales and marketing personnel, as well as travel costs related to sales, marketing and client service activities. Marketing costs also include costs of communication and branding materials, trade
	shows and public relations, as well as allocated overhead.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	expect our sales and marketing expenses to increase in absolute dollars as we strategically invest to grow our marketing operations and expand into new products and markets, but
	decrease as a percentage of revenue in the long term. We expect to hire additional sales personnel and related account management and sales support personnel as we continue to grow.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses consist principally of salaries and related costs for executives, administrative personnel and
	consultants, including stock-based compensation and travel expenses. Other general and administrative expenses include professional fees for legal, consulting and accounting services. General and
	administrative expenses are expensed when incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	expect that our general and administrative expenses will increase as we expand our infrastructure and transition to a public company. These increases will likely include increased
	costs for director and officer liability insurance, costs related to the hiring of additional personnel and increased fees for directors, outside consultants, lawyers and accountants. We also expect
	to incur significant costs to comply with corporate governance, internal controls and similar requirements applicable to public companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Remeasurement of Acquisition-related Contingent Consideration
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We classify our acquisition-related contingent consideration as a liability. Acquisition-related contingent consideration is subject
	to remeasurement at each balance sheet date. Any change in the fair value of such acquisition-related contingent consideration is reflected in our consolidated statements of operations as a change in
	fair value of the liability. We will continue to adjust the carrying value of the acquisition-related contingent consideration until the contingency is finally determined.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Depreciation and Amortization Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation and amortization expenses are primarily attributable to our capital investment in equipment and our capitalized software
	and acquisition-related intangibles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Change in Fair Value of Warrant Liability
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Warrants to purchase shares of our preferred stock are classified as warrant liabilities and recorded at fair value. This warrant
	liability is subject to remeasurement at each balance sheet date and we recognize any change in fair value in our consolidated statements of operations as a change in fair value of the warrant
	liability. Upon the completion of this offering, these warrants will automatically convert into warrants to purchase shares of our common stock. At that time, the liabilities will be reclassified to
	additional paid-in capital, a component of stockholders' equity (deficit).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=72,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=783386,FOLIO='69',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DA49301A.;58',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DA49301_1_70">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest Expense
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense is primarily attributable to interest expense associated with our revolving credit facility, term loans, related
	party notes, capital lease obligations and acquisition-related notes. It also includes the amortization of discounts on debt and amortization of deferred financing costs related to these various debt
	arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Accretion (Decretion) of Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The carrying values of Series&nbsp;A and Series&nbsp;A-1 redeemable convertible preferred stock are being accreted to their
	respective redemption values at each reporting period, from the date of issuance to the earliest date the holders can demand redemption. The carrying value of Series&nbsp;B redeemable convertible
	preferred stock is being accreted (decreted) to redemption value at each reporting period at the greater of (i)&nbsp;the original issuance price plus unpaid accrued dividends or (ii)&nbsp;the fair
	value of the redeemable convertible preferred stock. Upon the completion of this offering, our preferred stock will automatically convert into shares of our common stock. At that time, we will
	discontinue accreting our preferred stock to its redemption value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<TD STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=74,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=757796,FOLIO='71',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DC49301A.;64',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DC49301_1_72">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Comparison of the Six Months Ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Product Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Product revenue increased $10.7&nbsp;million, or 39%, from $27.3&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 to
	$38.0&nbsp;million for the comparable period in 2016. The increase was primarily driven by organic growth in medication risk management, which represented approximately $7.7&nbsp;million of the
	increase. Of that $7.7&nbsp;million increase, $2.5&nbsp;million was attributable to new customers acquired period over period, while the remaining $5.2&nbsp;million was attributable to increased
	prescription fulfillment volume from existing customers. Medication mix of prescriptions filled and payor mix contributed to an additional $3.0&nbsp;million of the overall increase in product
	revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Service Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Service revenue decreased $457&nbsp;thousand, or 9%, from $5.0&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 to
	$4.6&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. The decrease was primarily the result of a $1.1&nbsp;million decrease related to our pharmacy cost management services as a result
	of the loss of certain customers as well as a reduction in manufacturer fees related to the sale of medication utilization data. This decrease was partially offset by an increase of
	$587&nbsp;thousand in revenue related to our risk adjustment services. Of this total increase, $384&nbsp;thousand was related to revenue generated from new risk adjustment clients and
	$203&nbsp;thousand was attributable to organic growth with existing clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, revenue generated from our PMPM fees and subscription revenue was $1.9&nbsp;million and the remaining $3.1&nbsp;million represented
	hourly consulting charges, setup fees and data and statistics revenue. For the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, $2.4&nbsp;million related to PMPM fees and subscription revenue, and
	$2.2&nbsp;million represented hourly consulting charges, setup fees and data and statistics revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Product Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of product revenue increased $6.8&nbsp;million, or 32%, from $21.4&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015
	to $28.2&nbsp;million for the comparable period in 2016. This increase was largely driven by increased volume of revenue, which contributed $5.1&nbsp;million to the change. Manufacturer price
	increases and medication mix of prescriptions filled for our clients' patients contributed an additional $392&nbsp;thousand to the overall increase in the cost of product revenue. In addition, labor
	costs increased $1.0&nbsp;million, which was primarily due to added pharmacy headcount, including additional pharmacists, technicians and support staff, to support our growth, and distribution
	charges increase of $398&nbsp;thousand related to increased shipping volume for the medications we fulfilled for our clients' patients. These increases were partially offset by more favorable
	rebates on wholesale product purchases of prescription medications, which decreased the cost of the prescription medications we purchased for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 by
	$444&nbsp;thousand compared to the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Service Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of service revenue increased $321&nbsp;thousand, or 20%, from $1.6&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015
	to $1.9&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. The increase was primarily attributable to a $248&nbsp;thousand increase in risk adjustment personnel costs primarily due to
	added headcount to support client growth and increased salaries and benefits for existing employees related to market adjustments and performance-based increases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research and development expenses increased $664&nbsp;thousand, or 56%, from $1.2&nbsp;million for the six months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015 to $1.9&nbsp;million for the comparable period in 2016. The increase was primarily due to an increase in payroll and payroll-related costs for additional headcount as well as
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	72
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=75,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=24822,FOLIO='72',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DC49301A.;64',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DC49301_1_73">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	increases
	in salary and benefits for existing employees related to market adjustments and performance based increases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sales and Marketing Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales and marketing expenses increased $262&nbsp;thousand, or 19%, from $1.4&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
	2015 to $1.6&nbsp;million for the comparable period in 2016. The increase was primarily attributable to an increase in personnel costs, which increased $209&nbsp;thousand from the prior year,
	related to added headcount and increases in salaries and benefits for existing employees related to market adjustments and performance-based increases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses increased $419&nbsp;thousand, or 13%, from $3.3&nbsp;million for the six months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015 to $3.7&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. The increase was primarily attributable to a $225&nbsp;thousand increase in personnel costs, including
	salaries and benefits, primarily related to an increase in headcount to support the overall growth of our operations. In addition, an additional $98&nbsp;thousand of costs related to employee
	training and professional development contributed to the increase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Acquisition-related Contingent Consideration Expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, we recognized a $1.0&nbsp;million remeasurement gain as compared to a
	$99&nbsp;thousand remeasurement charge during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, related to the decretion and accretion, respectively, of contingent consideration associated with our
	Medliance acquisition. The gain during the six months ended June 30, 2015 was due to a decrease in projected revenue related to the loss of certain customers from Medliance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Depreciation and Amortization Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation and amortization expenses increased $196&nbsp;thousand, or 10%, from $1.9&nbsp;million for the six months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015 to $2.1&nbsp;million for the comparable period in 2016. This increase was primarily due to an increase in amortization of capitalized software related to new software
	functionality placed into service during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Change in Fair Value of Warrant Liability
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, we recognized a $184&nbsp;thousand loss for the change in fair value of warrant
	liability as compared to a gain of $13&nbsp;thousand during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. The change in fair value of warrant liability for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 was
	due to an increase in the fair value of our Series&nbsp;A-1 and Series&nbsp;B redeemable convertible preferred stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest Expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense increased $58&nbsp;thousand, or 2%, for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 compared to the six months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015 primarily due to the line of credit balance of $14.5&nbsp;million outstanding as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 compared to $10.0&nbsp;million outstanding as of June&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income Taxes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and June&nbsp;30, 2016, we recorded tax expense of $176&nbsp;thousand and
	$175&nbsp;thousand, respectively, which resulted in an effective tax rate of (34.6%) and 178.6%, respectively. The expense for each period was primarily related to deferred tax expense associated
	with indefinite-lived deferred tax liabilities for goodwill amortization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	73
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=76,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=679690,FOLIO='73',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DC49301A.;64',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DC49301_1_74">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Comparison of the Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Product Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Product revenue increased $13.2&nbsp;million, or 28%, from $46.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to
	$60.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was primarily driven by organic growth in our core business, medication risk management, which
	represented $9.0&nbsp;million of the increase. Of that $9.0&nbsp;million increase, $3.9&nbsp;million was attributable to new customers acquired year over year, while the remaining
	$5.1&nbsp;million was attributable to increased prescription fulfillment volume from existing customers. Manufacturer price increases, medication mix we fulfilled for our clients' patients and payor
	mix contributed to an additional $4.2&nbsp;million of the overall increase in product revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Service Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Service revenue increased $8.4&nbsp;million from $1.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to
	$10.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, which was primarily the result of a $7.0&nbsp;million increase related to our pharmacy cost management services associated with
	Medliance, which we acquired in December 2014. Of this increase, $595&nbsp;thousand was related to 12&nbsp;months of revenue from risk adjustment services related to Capstone for the period ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to only eight months for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Additionally, new risk adjustment customers acquired during 2015 contributed
	$372&nbsp;thousand to the increase and growth in service revenue from existing customers contributed $415&nbsp;thousand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, revenue generated from our PMPM fees and subscription revenue was $1.4&nbsp;million, while the remainder of the service revenue primarily
	related to hourly consulting charges and setup fees. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, $4.2&nbsp;million related to PMPM fees and subscription revenue and $5.8&nbsp;million represented
	hourly consulting charges and data and statistics revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Product Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of product revenue increased $8.8&nbsp;million, or 24%, from $37.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
	to $45.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This increase was largely driven by increased volume of revenue, which contributed $5.8&nbsp;million to the change, while
	manufacturer price increases and medication mix we fulfilled for our clients' patients contributed $2.5&nbsp;million to the overall increase in the cost of product revenue. In addition, labor costs
	increased $998&nbsp;thousand, which was primarily due to added pharmacy headcount, including additional pharmacists, technicians and support staff, to support our growth, as well as a
	$482&nbsp;thousand increase in distribution charges related to increased shipping volume for the medications we fulfilled for our clients' patients. Of this increase, $179&nbsp;thousand was
	attributable to increases in other normal pharmacy operating costs. These increases were offset by more favorable rebates on wholesale product purchases of prescription medications. Specifically, we
	joined a purchasing group in the first quarter of 2014 and, as a result, were able to gain access to more favorable pricing, which decreased the cost of the prescription medications we purchased by
	$1.2&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Service Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of service revenue increased $2.6&nbsp;million from $739&nbsp;thousand for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to
	$3.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Of the $2.6&nbsp;million increase, $1.9&nbsp;million was attributable to pharmacy cost management services related to Medliance,
	which we acquired in December 2014, and $262&nbsp;thousand was the result of risk adjustment services related to Capstone for the 12&nbsp;months ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to eight
	months for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The remainder of the increase was attributable to added headcount to support growth of our risk adjustment services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	74
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=77,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=360932,FOLIO='74',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DC49301A.;64',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DC49301_1_75">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research and development expenses increased $1.2&nbsp;million, or 73%, from $1.7&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 to $2.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The overall increase was primarily attributable to a $952&nbsp;thousand increase in payroll and
	payroll-related costs. Additionally, $285&nbsp;thousand of the increase was from expenses related to new Medliance product offerings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sales and Marketing Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales and marketing expenses increased $608&nbsp;thousand, or 27%, from $2.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 to $2.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was primarily attributable to a $245&nbsp;thousand increase in personnel costs, including salaries and benefits,
	related to market adjustments as well as performance-based increases for our existing employees. The remaining portion of the increase was principally related to increased marketing efforts, in
	particular marketing events and conferences, which contributed approximately $115&nbsp;thousand to the
	overall increase in such expenses. The increase in the period also included $164&nbsp;thousand in sales and marketing expenses related to the ongoing operations of Capstone and Medliance, each of
	which we acquired in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses increased $3.1&nbsp;million, or 79%, from $4.0&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 to $7.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was primarily attributable to a $1.2&nbsp;million increase in personnel costs, including
	salaries and benefits, related to an increase in headcount to support the overall growth of our operations. Finance and accounting fees increased by $922&nbsp;thousand as a result of higher costs
	related to preparation for this offering that did not qualify for deferral. Additionally, the increase in the period included $834&nbsp;thousand of general and administrative expenses related to the
	ongoing operations of Medliance, which we acquired in December 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Acquisition-related Contingent Consideration Expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recognized a $790&nbsp;thousand remeasurement charge, as compared to a
	$2.1&nbsp;million remeasurement gain during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, related to the contingent consideration associated with our acquisitions of SMPP, Capstone and Medliance. The
	remeasurement gain recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was due to a decrease in expected revenue for Medliance due to the loss of certain customers in 2015, which reduced the
	amount of contingent consideration we expect to pay.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Depreciation and Amortization Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation and amortization expenses increased $2.1&nbsp;million, or 116%, from $1.8&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 to $3.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This increase was due to an increase in depreciation expense of $138&nbsp;thousand primarily related to
	the continued capital investment in pharmacy and other equipment to support our medication adherence and fulfillment technology, an increase in amortization expense of $134&nbsp;thousand primarily
	due to capitalized internal-use software placed into service and an increase of $1.8&nbsp;million due to amortization expense related to acquisition-related intangibles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Change in Fair Value of Warrant Liability
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recognized $269&nbsp;thousand of expense for the change in fair value of warrant
	liability as compared to expense of $2.8&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The change in fair value of warrant liability for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	75
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=78,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=47108,FOLIO='75',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DC49301A.;64',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DC49301_1_76">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	was
	due to the increase in the fair value of our Series&nbsp;A-1 and Series&nbsp;B redeemable convertible preferred stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest Expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense increased $4.6&nbsp;million from $1.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to
	$5.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The increase was primarily attributable to interest payable and the amortization of debt discounts recorded in connection with various
	acquisition debt financing, including the Medliance Notes, in an aggregate amount of $4.6&nbsp;million, slightly offset by a decrease in interest payments as a result of continued principal payments
	on notes previously outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income Taxes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recognized expense of $328&nbsp;thousand related to state income taxes and
	deferred income tax expense. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recognized a $409&nbsp;thousand income tax benefit. The income tax benefit was
	primarily the result of deferred tax liabilities that were recorded in connection with the acquisition of SMPP, which created a source of recoverability of a portion of previously reserved deferred
	tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_DC49301_LIQUIDITY_AND_CAPITAL_RESOURCES">
</A>
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_TOC_DC49301_2">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Historically, we have incurred net losses from our operations. We incurred net losses of $1.1&nbsp;million and $2.9&nbsp;million
	for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively, and $685&nbsp;thousand and $77&nbsp;thousand for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016, respectively. Our primary
	liquidity and capital requirements are for research and development, sales and marketing, general and administrative expenses, debt service obligations and strategic business acquisitions. We have
	funded our operations, working capital needs and investments with cash generated through operations, issuance of preferred stock and borrowings under our credit facilities. At June&nbsp;30, 2016, we
	had cash of $4.3&nbsp;million. Through June&nbsp;30, 2016, we had received net proceeds of $13.5&nbsp;million from the issuance of our preferred and common stock, including pursuant to the
	exercise of stock options.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_CASH_FLOW>
<A NAME="FIS_CASH_FLOW"></A>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>

	June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016.
</FONT>

<FONT>

<FONT>

	&#8203;
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Operating Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash provided by operating activities was $1.6&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and consisted
	primarily of our net loss of $685&nbsp;thousand and changes in our operating assets and liabilities totaling $208&nbsp;thousand, which was offset by the addition of noncash items of
	$2.5&nbsp;million. The significant factors that contributed to the change in operating assets and liabilities
	included an increase in accounts receivable due to an increased customer base and higher sales volumes, and the payment of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	76
</FONT>

<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DC49301_1_77">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	contingent
	purchase price consideration related to the acquisitions of SMPP and Capstone, which were partially offset by an increase in accounts payable due to increased purchases and extended payment
	terms. The noncash items primarily included depreciation and amortization expenses related to leasehold improvements, capital equipment, capitalized internal-use software development costs, and
	acquisition related intangibles of $1.9&nbsp;million, amortization of deferred financing fees and debt discounts of $1.0&nbsp;million, stock-based compensation expenses of $312&nbsp;thousand, an
	increase in the fair value of the warrant liability of $184&nbsp;thousand, and an expense of $176&nbsp;thousand related to deferred income taxes. The noncash items were partially offset by a
	decrease in the fair value of the acquisition related contingent consideration of $1.0&nbsp;million and payments of $105&nbsp;thousand for imputed interest on debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash provided by operating activities was $6.9&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and consisted primarily of our net loss of $77&nbsp;thousand, offset by
	changes in our operating assets and liabilities totaling $3.8&nbsp;million and the addition of noncash items of $3.2&nbsp;million. The significant factors that contributed to the change in
	operating assets and liabilities primarily included a net increase in accrued expenses and other long-term liabilities for deferred rent expense related to our new office location for our headquarters
	and accrued interest on the Medliance Notes, which is classified as long-term. Cash provided by operating activities was also due to an increase in accounts payable primarily due to increased
	inventory purchases to support higher revenue growth. The noncash items primarily included depreciation and amortization expenses related to leasehold improvements, capital equipment, capitalized
	internal-use software development costs, and acquisition related intangibles of $2.1&nbsp;million, amortization of deferred financing fees and debt discounts of $1.2&nbsp;million, stock-based
	compensation expense of $258&nbsp;thousand, an expense of $133&nbsp;thousand for deferred income taxes, and an expense of $99&nbsp;thousand for the revaluation of acquisition contingent
	consideration, which were partially offset by payments of $589&nbsp;thousand for imputed interest on debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash provided by operating activities was $870&nbsp;thousand for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and consisted primarily of our net loss of $1.1&nbsp;million and changes
	in our operating assets and liabilities totaling $1.0&nbsp;million, offset by noncash items of $3.0&nbsp;million. The significant factors that contributed to the change in operating assets and
	liabilities included increases in accounts receivable, inventories and rebates receivable, which were directly related to the increase in product sales, partially offset by increases in accounts
	payable of $1.4&nbsp;million and accrued expenses and other liabilities of $604&nbsp;thousand, each of which was primarily due to the timing of our vendor payments and the purchase of prescription
	medications to build inventory to support our increase in sales. The noncash items primarily included depreciation and amortization expenses related to leasehold improvements, capital equipment and
	capitalized internal-use software development costs of $1.8&nbsp;million, amortization of deferred financing fees of $259&nbsp;thousand, stock-based compensation expenses of $254&nbsp;thousand
	and an expense of $790&nbsp;thousand for the revaluation of acquisition contingent consideration partially offset by deferred income tax benefit of $422&nbsp;thousand. The income tax benefit was
	primarily the result of deferred tax liabilities that were
	recorded in connection with the acquisition of SMPP, which created a source of recoverability of a portion of previously reserved deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash provided by operating activities was $3.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and consisted primarily of our net loss of $2.9&nbsp;million and
	decreases in cash from changes in our operating assets and liabilities totaling $1.4&nbsp;million, which were more than offset by non-cash charges of $7.6&nbsp;million, which were primarily
	attributable to depreciation and amortization expenses related to leasehold improvements, capital equipment and capitalized internal-use software development costs of $3.9&nbsp;million, amortization
	of deferred financing fees and debt discount of $2.1&nbsp;million, stock-based compensation expense of $565&nbsp;thousand, the non-cash expense related to the revaluation of the warrant liability
	of $2.8&nbsp;million partially offset by a gain of $2.1&nbsp;million for the revaluation of acquisition-related contingent consideration. The significant factors that contributed to the decrease
	in cash from changes in operating assets and liabilities included increases in accounts receivable, inventories and prepaid expenses and other assets due to the increase in our product sales and the
	timing of payments associated with rent and 2016 conferences, partially offset by increases in accounts payable of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	77
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$440&nbsp;thousand
	primarily due to the timing of our vendor payments and the purchase of prescription medications to build inventory that supports our increase in sales, and accrued expenses and
	other liabilities of $1.1&nbsp;million due to the increase in accrued interest on acquisition-related notes payable, offset by a $610&nbsp;thousand decrease primarily attributable to contingent
	considerations payments made in connection with the acquisition of Capstone in excess of the estimated amount accrued as of the acquisition date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Investing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash used in investing activities was $2.7&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and $3.3&nbsp;million
	for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. Investing activities for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 reflects $2.4&nbsp;million paid in connection with the acquisition of Medliance,
	along with $449&nbsp;thousand paid for software development costs and $123&nbsp;thousand in purchases of property and equipment. Net cash used in investing activities during 2015 was offset by a
	decrease of $300&nbsp;thousand in restricted cash from the release of funds related to a contingent purchase price payment for the SMPP acquisition. Net cash used in investing activities for the six
	months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 reflects $2.9&nbsp;million in purchases of property, equipment and leasehold improvements primarily related to our new office location for our headquarters and
	$576&nbsp;thousand in software development costs, which were partially offset by a decrease of $200&nbsp;thousand in restricted cash from the release of funds for the final acquisition
	consideration payment related to the SMPP acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash used in investing activities was $14.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and $3.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Investing
	activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 reflects $13.4&nbsp;million paid in connection with the acquisitions of SMPP, Capstone and Medliance, net of cash acquired, along with
	$230&nbsp;thousand in purchases of property and equipment, a $500&nbsp;thousand increase in restricted cash due to funds placed in escrow for the SMPP acquisition and $738&nbsp;thousand in
	software development costs. Investing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 reflects $2.4&nbsp;million paid in connection with the acquisition of Medliance, along with
	$234&nbsp;thousand in purchases of property and equipment and $940&nbsp;thousand in software development costs, offset by a decrease of $300&nbsp;thousand in restricted cash from the release of
	funds related to a contingent purchase price payment for the SMPP acquisition that was paid.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Financing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash used in financing activities was $433&nbsp;thousand for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and $1.3&nbsp;million
	for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016. Financing activities for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 were primarily attributable to the $6.9&nbsp;million repayment of the 2013 Credit
	Facility, $2.2&nbsp;million in payments of deferred and contingent purchase price consideration related to our Capstone and SMPP acquisitions, and $1.1&nbsp;million in payments of long-term debt.
	Net cash used in financing activities was partially offset by net borrowings of $10.0&nbsp;million under the 2015 Line of Credit. Financing activities for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016
	primarily reflect $2.7&nbsp;million in payments of long-term debt, $2.1&nbsp;million in payments of deferred and contingent purchase price consideration related to our SMPP and Medliance
	acquisitions, and payments of $982&nbsp;thousand for deferred costs associated with this offering. Net cash used in financing activities was partially offset by net borrowings of $4.5&nbsp;million
	under the 2015 Line of Credit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	78
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=81,EFW="2229822",CP="TABULA RASA HEALTHCARE",DN="1",CHK=715200,FOLIO='78',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCD1.15ZCD49301]DC49301A.;64',USER='OALBERT',CD='26-SEP-2016;06:47' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DE49301_1_79">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229822ZS-1A_HTM_BG49301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash provided by financing activities was $12.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to net cash used in financing
	activities of $2.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Financing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 primarily reflect net borrowings under our various
	financing arrangements of $13.2&nbsp;million offset by $212&nbsp;thousand in deferred financing costs and $927&nbsp;thousand in payments of deferred and contingent purchase price consideration
	related to our SMPP acquisition. Financing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were primarily attributable to net borrowings of $625&nbsp;thousand under our various financing
	arrangements offset by $69&nbsp;thousand in deferred financing costs, $2.2&nbsp;million in payments of deferred and contingent purchase price consideration related to our SMPP and Capstone
	acquisitions and $481&nbsp;thousand in payments of deferred costs associated with this offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Funding Requirements
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Historically, we have incurred net losses since our inception and we had an accumulated deficit of $31.6&nbsp;million as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. Following this offering, we will be a publicly
	traded company and will incur significant legal, accounting and other expenses that we were not required to incur as a private company. In addition, the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, as well as rules adopted by
	the SEC and NASDAQ Stock Market, require public companies to implement specified corporate governance practices that are currently inapplicable to us as a private company. We expect these rules and
	regulations will increase our legal and financial compliance costs and will make some activities more time-consuming and costly. We estimate that we will incur approximately $1.0&nbsp;million to
	$2.0&nbsp;million in incremental costs per year as a result of being a publicly traded company, although it is possible that our actual incremental costs will be higher than we currently estimate.
	Additionally, as disclosed in note&nbsp;9 to our audited consolidated financial statements, we were required to pay $16.4&nbsp;million pursuant to the terms of the Medliance Notes. We have paid
	the Medliance Notes in full as of July&nbsp;1, 2016 and they are no longer outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	believe that the net proceeds of this offering, together with our cash of $4.3&nbsp;million as of June&nbsp;30, 2016, borrowing capacity under our 2015 Line of Credit, our ABC
	Credit Facility and cash flows from continuing operations, will be sufficient to fund our planned operations through at least March&nbsp;31, 2018. Our ability to maintain successful operations will
	depend on, among other things, new business, the retention of clients and the effectiveness of sales and marketing initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	may seek additional funding through public or private debt or equity financings. We may not be able to obtain financing on acceptable terms, or at all. The terms of any financing may
	adversely affect our stockholders. If we are unable to obtain funding, we could be forced to delay, reduce or eliminate our research and development programs, product portfolio expansion or
	commercialization efforts, which could adversely affect our business prospects. There is no assurance that we will be successful in obtaining sufficient funding on terms acceptable to us to fund
	continuing operations, if at all.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	79
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Non-contingent consideration payments(6)

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Table
	does not reflect our obligations pursuant to the ABC Credit Facility, which was entered into in July 2016. Pursuant to the terms of the ABC Credit
	Facility, we will make monthly interest payments beginning on August&nbsp;1, 2016. The maturity date of the ABC Credit Facility is December&nbsp;30, 2021. The principal amount outstanding under
	the ABC Credit Facility as of July&nbsp;1, 2016 was $30.0&nbsp;million, which is not included in the table above, and our aggregate cash obligation to pay such amount is due in more than five
	years. In addition, the table does not reflect up to an additional $5.0&nbsp;million of cash consideration payable to a third party in connection with our acquisition of primarily intellectual
	property and software assets in September 2016, $4.4&nbsp;million of which is due in less than one year and $600&nbsp;thousand of which would be due, if payable, between one and three years.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Revolver
	represents the principal balance outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 under the 2015 Line of Credit which was amended on July&nbsp;1, 2016
	to, among other things, increase the aggregate amount that may be borrowed up to $25.0&nbsp;million. As disclosed in note&nbsp;9 of our audited consolidated financial statements, we were required
	to pay $16.4&nbsp;million on June&nbsp;30, 2016, related to the Medliance Notes, which could have adversely impacted our ability to maintain compliance with the liquidity covenant set forth in the
	loan agreement for the 2015 Line of Credit. Due to this uncertainty, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we have classified the amount outstanding on the 2015 Revolving Line as a current liability on our
	consolidated balance sheet at December&nbsp;31, 2015. As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, we had $14.5&nbsp;million of debt outstanding under the 2015 Line of Credit. However, we have repaid the Medliance
	Notes in full as of July&nbsp;1, 2016 and they are no longer outstanding.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Long-term
	debt represents contractual obligations outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 under our senior secured term loans, including both principal
	and interest. As disclosed in note&nbsp;9 of our audited consolidated financial statements, we were required to pay $16.4&nbsp;million pursuant to the terms of the Medliance Notes, which was
	satisfied on July&nbsp;1, 2016. Because such payment was uncertain at that time, the balance of the April 2014 Eastward Loan and the December 2014 Eastward Loan are included in the current portion
	of long term debt on our consolidated balance sheet as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. However, we have paid the Medliance Notes and each Eastward Loan in full as of July&nbsp;1, 2016, and they are no
	longer outstanding.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>

	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Related
	party notes represents the principal balances outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 on outstanding indebtedness due to related parties.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
